description: Borrowed from Latin lūbricātus, past participle of lūbricō (“make slippery”), from lūbricus (“slippery”).

verbs.description: lubricate (third-person singular simple present lubricates, present participle lubricating, simple past and past participle lubricated)

entries.meaning: To make slippery or smooth (normally to minimize friction) by applying a lubricant.
